snippet: Witnesses said Ziad Abu Ein, 55, who held a position equivalent to the rank of a minister in the Palestinian Authority government, was struck and shoved by an Israeli soldier and inhaled tear gas.
abstract: Ziad Abu Ein, prominent Palestinian Authority official, dies after inhaling tear gas and being shoved and struck in chest by member of Israeli security forces during demonstration in West Bank village; episode threatens to grow into crisis between Israel and authority amid calls for halt in security coordination between two sides.

byline.original: By ISABEL KERSHNER and SAID GHAZALI
byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner reported from Jerusalem, and Said Ghazali from Turmus Aya, West Bank. Robert Mackey contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Witnesses said Ziad Abu Ein, 55, who held a position equivalent to the rank of a minister in the Palestinian Authority government, was struck and shoved by an Israeli soldier and inhaled tear gas.

headline.main: Calls for Calm After Palestinian Official Dies During Protest in the West Bank
headline.print_headline: Calls for Calm After Palestinian Official Dies During Protest in the West Bank
